cyclone.name: EMILY
cyclone.current_location: about 65 miles WSW of Tampa, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Moving east across central Florida today, then turning northeast and accelerating offshore of the east-central Florida coast toward the western Atlantic
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: west-central Florida coast near the Tampa Bay area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Anclote River to Englewood on the west coast of Florida
weather_observation.impacted_coast: West-central Florida peninsula today, then east-central Florida coast and the offshore waters of the southeastern United States through mid-week
weather_observation.rain_fall_above_4_inch: Unlikely (generally 1–2 in., isolated up to 4 in.)
weather_observation.wind: Breezy with occasional gusts 25–35 mph; tropical-storm-force winds unlikely (<3% probability)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None significant expected on the Atlantic side
weather_observation.rainfall: Periods of heavy showers Monday afternoon into Monday night with totals 1–2 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: Elevated rip-current risk and minor coastal flooding possible along Atlantic beaches
